sentence.text: Multivariable logistic regression analysis with adjustment for age and negative regulation of cell adhesion revealed that all 25, 28 and 65 of these SNPs were significantly associated with hypertriglyceridemia, hypo‑HDL‑cholesterolemia and hyper‑LDL‑cholesterolemia, respectively.

Following examination of the association of the identified SNPs to serum concentrations of triglycerides, HDL‑cholesterol, or LDL‑cholesterol, linkage disequilibrium of the SNPs, and results of previous genome‑wide association studies, we newly identified chromosomal region 19p12 as a susceptibility locus for hypertriglyceridemia, eight loci (MOB3C‑TMOD4, positive regulation of fatty acid biosynthetic process, endocytic recycling, growth plate cartilage chondrocyte morphogenesis, ZNF860‑CACNA1D, cell adhesion, double-strand break repair via nonhomologous end joining, biological_process) for hypo‑HDL‑cholesterolemia, and three loci (KIAA0319‑FAM65B, ubiquitin-dependent protein catabolic process, LOC105375015) for hyper‑LDL‑cholesterolemia.

entity.text: positive regulation of fatty acid biosynthetic process
double-strand break repair via nonhomologous end joining
